    • Method Detail

      • processFailure

        public void processFailure(Message<?> message,
                           SupervisedActorRef<?> self,
                           Throwable error)
        Description copied from interface: Supervisor
        Processes an error thrown by Actor.onMessage(com.github.davidmoten.reels.Message<T>) or by Actor.onStop(com.github.davidmoten.reels.ActorRef<T>) or by Actor.preStart(com.github.davidmoten.reels.ActorRef<T>).

        An error thrown by the Actor.onStop(com.github.davidmoten.reels.ActorRef<T>) will be wrapped in an OnStopException.

        An error thrown by the Actor.preStart(com.github.davidmoten.reels.ActorRef<T>) will be wrapped in a PreStartException.

        This method must not throw.

        Note that because the method is provided with the actorRef, the dispose method can be called on the actorRef which will stop all further processing of messages including already queued ones. If the actorRef is not disposed then message processing will continue with subsequent messages as normal.

        A SupervisedActorRef can restart the actor (recreate the actor object which discards current state in the actor) but retain the queued messages. This should only be called synchronously in the processFailure method because of type safety constraints.

        Specified by:
        processFailure in interface Supervisor
        Parameters:
        message - message the actor failed to process (includes context reference)
        self - reference to the actor where the error occurred
        error - the error throw in the Actor.onMessage method. Wrapped in OnStopException if thrown by onStop method, or PreStartException if thrown by the preStart method.
